node.title: It Really Would Help if People Learned to Email
node.description: You should never find out that you were someone’s second choice.

node.title: Elite Wine Group Moves to Expel 6 Members in Sexual Harassment Inquiry
node.description: The American chapter of the Court of Master Sommeliers says it investigated 22 members. But at least one woman who came forward feels that’s not enough.

node.title: Former Professor Is Indicted in ‘Arson Spree’ in California
node.description: Prosecutors say Gary Stephen Maynard set four fires this summer as one of the largest wildfires in California history raged nearby.

node.title: Seminary President Protests Screening of Film Examining 'Wokeness' Within Church
node.description: Southwestern Baptist Theological Seminary's Adam Greenway has asked a fellow seminary president to forego screening the film "Enemies Within: The Church."

node.title: NASA Wants to Build Sustainable Power Plant on Moon, Then Mars
node.description: NASA and the U.S. Department of Energy's Idaho National Laboratory requested proposals for an initial design for a nuclear fission power plant on the moon.

node.title: White Cop Convicted of Fatally Shooting Black Man After Prosecutors Say Evidence Was Planted
node.description: "I miss my baby, and this just did not have to be," the mother of Cameron Lamb said after officer Eric DeValkenaere was found guilty of killing her son.

node.title: ‘There's a lot of hidden talent up here’: Clancy spots future Olympic talent in Far North Queensland
node.description: The Australian Olympic Committee has taken its search for future 2032 Brisbane Olympians to remote Far North Queensland, where they believe lies a pool of talented athletes.

node.title: How to Make the Best Thanksgiving Topping
node.description: Add crispiness to just about any dish with this shallot and bread crumb crunch from Samin Nosrat.

node.title: Companies Love to Buy Back Their Stock. A Tax Could Deter Them.
node.description: Supporters of the Biden buyback tax say it will be good for the economy. Skeptics say it will hurt investment.

node.title: SCOTUS to Issue At Least 1 Ruling Monday, Unknown if Texas Abortion Case to Be Included
node.description: SCOTUS heard the two cases filed against Texas' controversial abortion law on November 1.

node.title: FBI Confirms Seizing Phones, Other Devices From Project Veritas Members as Part of Probe
node.description: The FBI seized items for an investigation into how Project Veritas received a diary that allegedly belonged to President Joe Biden's daughter, Ashley.

node.title: 'Thought it was a scam': Big change for Brisbane phone numbers
node.description: Residents are feeling Brisbane's growth spurt in their commutes, house prices and rapid development. But there's another change that could surprise you.

node.title: 'Here is your baby, I think he's going to die': After 42 years, Jaii continues to defy all the odds
node.description: As Kay Mitchell cradled a bundle of blankets at Adelaide Airport she "hoped to goodness" her tiny adopted son from India was alive.

node.title: West Auckland locals alert and cautious as gun violence increases
node.description: A West Auckland local board member is trying to soothe her community's nerves after three shootings in 10 days.

node.title: Officials take steps to expand COVID vaccine boosters for all adults
node.description: Many states have already moved to allow all adults to receive a COVID vaccine booster shot, ahead of the FDA and CDC's decision.

node.title: WNYC Retracts Four Articles on Its News Site, Gothamist
node.description: In a new episode of turmoil at the radio station, the author of the articles was reassigned.

node.title: C.D.C. Panel Endorses Covid Vaccine Booster Shots for All Adults
node.description: As infections rise, Americans over 18 will be permitted to get extra doses. But it’s not clear boosters really are needed by so many people, or that the shots will turn back the pandemic.

node.title: The jury acquitted Kyle Rittenhouse on all of these five counts.
node.description: Kyle Rittenhouse was cleared of criminal culpability in the shooting of three white men, two of them fatally, during protests on Aug. 25, 2020.

node.title: Police Now Say 5-Year-Old Michael Vaughn, Missing Since July, Likely Kidnapped Near Home
node.description: Michael Vaughn was last seen in front of his home on July 27. He was wearing a light blue Minecraft T-shirt, dark blue boxer briefs and flip-flops.

node.title: After Kyle Rittenhouse's Acquittal, Will His Rifle Be Returned to Him?
node.description: Prior to the not guilty verdict, Rittenhouse maintained his innocence and claimed that he was acting in self-defense.

node.title: Puppies, Fake Apps Among Scams Better Business Bureau Says to Watch for in Holiday Season
node.description: The organization released a "Naughty List" of potential holiday scams designed to take advantage of people during the holidays.

node.title: 'Expect delivery delays': Parcel volumes surge as festive season looms
node.description: Parcel delivery is up 100 percent over the pre-Covid-19 period as customers rush to get their orders in for the holiday season.

node.title: Battle stations for both All Blacks and Black Ferns
node.description: Comment: There's a common misconception about the famous Maginot Line, the massive series of fortifications built in the 1930s to defend France's eastern border from a German invasion, Jamie Wall writ…

node.title: Paine steps down as Australia test captain after 'sexting' scandal
node.description: Tim Paine has stepped down as Australian men's Test cricket captain after revealing he was involved in a sexting scandal.

node.title: Why PM Modi rolled back India's controversial farm laws
node.description: The decision to repeal the farm laws is a strategic and political move and an admission of BJP's haste.

node.title: Roger Federer to Miss Australian Open and All but Rules Out Wimbledon
node.description: Recovering from his fourth knee operation, Federer, at 40, has no illusions about winning a 21st major title. He wants to return for different reasons.

node.title: The C.E.O. of Afiniti, an A.I. start-up, steps down after accusations of sexual assault.
node.description: Zia Chishti resigned from the artificial-intelligence company he founded after a former employee accused him of sexual misconduct.

node.title: Ohio State Launching Pilot Program for 125 Students to Graduate Debt-Free in 4 Years
node.description: The goal is to integrate the program over a decade starting next fall, with an estimated cost of about $100 million a year.

node.title: Nebraska Unemployment Rate of 1.9 Percent Lowest Any State Has Ever Recorded
node.description: "The record rate is a sign of our strong job growth, successful reemployment services, and extraordinary economic resilience," Governor Pete Ricketts said.
